page.title: 05DAIRY FARM NEAR BRECHIN
page.content: {Stannochy}lies on the south bank of the South Esk one mile from Brechin. The long day begins with the 4 a.m. milking of the{136 Freisian}cows. This takes the dairymen between one and two hours. The rest of the day before the afternoon milking is taken up with tending the cattle and in washing the dairy. Work in the fields has also to be fitted in. The milk is transported to the{Milk Board}by a lorry each day. During the winter the herd is kept inside and fed on silage and cake whereas in summer they graze the permanent and rotation pastures. All the cattle are bred on the farm. At two years old they are introduced into the herd and are milked for approximately 3 years. The dairy farmer has a full year with the cows always needing some attention.
